channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Have you had a hard talk with an older driver? Tell us about it
item.description: Have you thought about taking the keys away from an older driver in your life? NPR wants to hear your story about how you navigated a difficult situat...

item.title: Greetings from a Paris park, where a lone sequoia tree is a marvel to behold
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: A walking challenge to start 2026 on your feet — and off your screens
item.description: The solution to too much sitting is simple but hard to stick with. This walking challenge sets you up for success, with six tips to keep you moving th...

item.title: U.S. seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker with ties to Venezuela
item.description: U.S. forces have seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the north Atlantic after a two week chase. This is part of the larger U.S. campaign aimed at t...

item.title: GOP gearing up to face tough midterms. And, Pentagon reviews women in ground combat
item.description: Trump offers advice to the GOP as midterm fears grow and he struggles to connect with voters on the economy. And, the Pentagon reviews the "effectiven...

item.title: Nigeria's ex-justice minister granted bail in $6m corruption case
item.description: Abubakar Malami was one of the most influential figures in the administration of former President Buhari.

item.title: Iran leans into anti-Western bluster as it grapples with deadly protests
item.description: Iran says it has hanged a man who spied for Israel and is ready for a new military confrontation as it struggles to tamp down domestic unrest.

item.title: Rare mountain gorilla twins born in Africa's oldest national park
item.description: Trackers in DR Congo's Virunga National Park spotted the babies being hugged by their mother on Saturday.

item.title: U.S. military seizes 2 oil tankers linked to Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. carried out operations Wednesday to seize the oil tankers Marinera and Sophia, officials announced.

item.title: U.S. seizes tankers as Trump's Venezuela strategy draws scrutiny from Congress
item.description: The U.S. carried out operations Wednesday to seize two Venezuela-linked tankers as Trump administration officials prepared to brief all senators on Ve...

item.title: Venezuela's interim leader sacks general in charge of Maduro's guard
item.description: General Javier Marcano Tábata was the commander of the inner circle of guards tasked with protecting Maduro.

item.title: Big freeze causes travel chaos across western Europe
item.description: More than 700 flights were cancelled at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport alone on Wednesday.

item.title: 'Fear in the streets': Venezuelans uncertain about what might happen next
item.description: The BBC spoke to Venezuelans after the seizure by US forces of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Anti-government protests in Iran turn deadly
item.description: Iranians continue to protest the current government amid economic fears. CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer reports as the manifestations enter a second week.

item.title: Watch Live: House Oversight Committee holds hearing on Minnesota fraud

item.title: Homeland Security plans 2,000 officers in Minnesota for its ‘largest immigration operation ever’
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security says it has launched in Minnesota what it’s calling the largest immigration enforcement operation ever carried out...

item.title: Shooter who killed Brown students and MIT professor planned attack for years, DOJ says
President Trump says his voters loved the Venezuela attack — here’s what they think
